column4: I am not understanding section 3.3 for NDISWrapper on the wireless site

I don't understand this part - Retrieve the Windows driver corresponding to your chipset: Use the ID information you have just found and the ndiswrapper list to find and download the correct windows driver files for your wireless adapter, or one which is very similar (same chipset ID).
Can anyone help?
with this ndiswrapper...newb to linux here
I am there already Daft_Punk, thanks though....I have questions about the content that its asking me
I've done a couple times already...here it goes again

3.3. Downloading Windows Drivers Retrieve the Windows driver corresponding to your chipset: Use the ID information you have just found and the ndiswrapper list to find and download the correct windows driver files for your wireless adapter, or one which is very similar (same chipset ID).
Not sure how to do this
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/Ndiswrapper
thanks again, but thats the exact page I am on.  Section 3.3 of that page is what I am stuck on
lol sorry that looks too complicated for me :(
what is your computer model
its an HP G60-249WM
I am having to follow this NDISWrapper because ubuntu doesn't have a driver for my wireless card
did you install ubuntu, or are you using just the livecd
I am using the livecd right now, want to make sure I can get wireless working before I install it
i am not 100% sure that the wireless would always work in livecd and not the actual os
do u know which card it is
I'm pretty sure its my wireless card cause others who have it had to use ndiswrapper to get there wireless to work.  Daft_Punk its an Atheros AR242
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=854059 scroll down and read the posts near the end
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=756318
it says if you boot into vista and it says ur card is the ar5007 then you can follow this link to try to fix it: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=743299&highlight=atheros+ar5007
when I put in wget -c http://snapshots.madwifi.org/special/madwifi-ng-r2756+ar5007.tar.gz in the terminal I get wget -c http://snapshots.madwifi.org/special/madwifi-ng-r2756+ar5007.tar.gz
